A common expression in the 50’s, where “fever” was either or both “A condition of heightened activity or excitement: a fever of anticipation.
oe a contagious, usually short-lived enthusiasm or craze.”

Though Peggy Lee’s 1959 “Fever” was instrumental in bringing the expressions forth, a year after “Dizzy Miss Lizzy” was written, the song actually was written in 1956 and recorded by Little Willie John and made it to the top of the R&B charts.
